data.meta_description: Marshall Group | 50,865 followers on LinkedIn. For over sixty years, we‚Äôve amplified the sound of the world‚Äôs most talented artists. data.text:
Marshall maintains strong momentum in successful first quarter We have continued our strong revenue and profit growth journey into the first quarter of 2024 with net sales increasing 14 percent to SEK 978.0 million. Building on a historic and successful 2023, we are off to a great start in 2024 by introducing well-received product updates, showing up for both musicians and music lovers and delivering strong financial results. ‚ÄúDespite the macro-economic uncertainties influencing consumer spending and the geo-political tension causing turbulences across the supply-chain, we managed to deliver our best first quarter to date on top of an extremely strong comparable quarter in 2023. Demand for Marshall products continues to be strong, and we have an exceptional product portfolio and roadmap to lean into‚Äù, says our CEO Jeremy de Maillard. Want to dig into more numbers? Click here: https://lnkd.in/dQ95AKaW

Get in touch with Marshall for Business! Another brand new part of our new website is our B2B services for hotels, small and medium businesses as well as companies looking to gift their employees with Marshall products. Whether you‚Äôre looking for a new easy-to-set-up audio solution for your shop or restaurant, individual speakers for hotel rooms or if you just want to make your employees happy gifting them products from Marshall, you can visit our site to take part of our various offers aligned to your business and get in touch. Please also see links to testimonials and our different business offer pages in comments section below. P.S. If you‚Äôre also looking for curated music with commercial licenses our partners Activaire - Expertly curated background music and Stingray can help.

The Marshall Funhouse - Bringing The Loud To The Austin Music Community! Every so often a pivotal moment happens in the music industry where new rules are made, new standards are set and new eras begin. That happened this week at the Marshall Funhouse in Austin, Texas at SXSW. For three days the Marshall Funhouse took over one of SXSW‚Äôs most iconic venues in a colourful, charismatic and loud way with one key goal: To give back to the communities that make Austin such a vibrant and cultural city. Every day, we gave the stage to grassroots musicians from Austin who are pushing the boundaries of music and combined them with some of the most iconic names in the musical world such as Dinosaur Jr, The Black Angels, Shannon And The Clams and Frank Turner to name just a few. Of course, this was also coupled with a number of sensational bands from the Marshall Records family in a one of a kind showcase evening. Over the course of the event, we exemplified our belief that rock and roll is not a genre, but an attitude. And it demands your attention. At Marshall, we believe in giving back to the communities that help keep music alive and are actively working every day to inspire the next generation of musicians to plug in their guitars, turn up their amps and make their voices heard. That is why The Marshall Funhouse was not only a free event open to the general public, but featured a selected a number of partners who embody this ethos and are making real differences in their local communities. From School Of Rock, who are inspiring the next generation of musicians, to The SIMMS Foundation offering safe spaces for musicians and their support networks, to Women In Vinyl who are rewriting the rules and offering opportunities to women and non binary communities trying to navigate the musical world - there was something for everyone to get involved in. With over 20,000 attendees over the three days and countless memories and laughs along the way, we believe the Marshall Funhouse has changed live events forever‚Ä¶and there‚Äôs only more to come. üëÄüé™ #MarshallFunhouse #SXSW24
